definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: What advice do you have for anyone looking to start a collection of single malts ?
sentences.chinese: 你對那些想開始收藏單麥芽威士忌的人有何建議？

sentences.english: Neil: There's also the world's largest collection of TVs.
sentences.chinese: 這裏還有世界收藏量最廣最大的各種電視機。

sentences.english: The painter bequeathed his collection of art treasures to a museum.
sentences.chinese: 這位畫家把他收藏的美術珍品遺贈給一個博物館。

sentences.english: The tenet of superiority for broad hall is built and promoted the collectors.
sentences.chinese: 文博會館的宗旨也是爲廣大收藏者而倡建的。

sentences.english: One of my friends liked to collect postcards.
sentences.chinese: 我的一個朋友喜歡收藏明信片。

sentences.english: Collectibles have been a part of almost every culture since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 從古代開始，收藏品就是文化的一部分。

sentences.english: There is a place in our heart for bottled-up memories.
sentences.chinese: 我的心裏總有一個柔軟的角落，收藏記憶的瓶瓶罐罐。

sentences.english: Investigation and collection of the Aerolite.
sentences.chinese: 隕石的研究和收藏等若干章節。

sentences.english: Provide dedicated glass art, collectibles and silverware tall.
sentences.chinese: 竭誠提供琉璃藝術品，收藏品及銀飾掛飾。

sentences.english: The first Chinese book entered the Library as early as 1632.
sentences.chinese: 圖書館早在1632年開始收藏提一本中國書。

sentences.english: Neil: And there's the world's largest collection of TVs.
sentences.chinese: 這裏還有世界收藏量最廣最大的各種電視機。

sentences.english: A legendary old man collected a precious imperial carriage of the Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 一位傳奇老人收藏有唐代的珍品鑾輿。

sentences.english: Once it has lived out its month-long life, the butterfly will join the museum's collection.
sentences.chinese: 當它結束了幾個月的生命後，將被博物館收藏。

sentences.english: Tie the paintbrushes up into bundles and put them away carefully.
sentences.chinese: 把畫筆束成捆，然後好好收藏起來。

sentences.english: Examples of its craftsmanship are now very collectable .
sentences.chinese: 現在它的那些工藝的樣品極有收藏價值。

definition: to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
the strokes of a character/calligraphy and painting
